title: 2019–20 Scottish League Cup
text:
The 2019–20 <a href="Scottish%20League%20Cup">Scottish League Cup</a> (also known as the <a href="Betfred">Betfred</a> Cup for sponsorship reasons) was the 74th season of <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>'s second-most prestigious <a href="association%20football">football</a> knockout competition.
The format for the 2019–20 competition was the same as the previous three seasons.
It began with eight groups of five teams which included all <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Scottish%20Professional%20Football%20League">2018–19 Scottish Professional Football League</a> (SPFL) clubs, excluding those competing in <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20UEFA%20Champions%20League">Champions League</a> and <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20UEFA%20Europa%20League">Europa League</a> qualifiers, as well as the winners of the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Highland%20Football%20League">2018–19 Highland Football League</a> (<a href="Cove%20Rangers%20F.C.">Cove Rangers</a>) and the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Lowland%20Football%20League">2018–19 Lowland Football League</a> (<a href="East%20Kilbride%20F.C.">East Kilbride</a>).
Format.
The competition began with eight groups of five teams. The four clubs competing in the <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a> (<a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a>) and <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">Europa League</a> (<a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a>, <a href="Kilmarnock%20F.C.">Kilmarnock</a>, and <a href="Aberdeen%20F.C.">Aberdeen</a>) qualifying rounds were given a bye through to the second round. The 40 teams competing in the group stage consisted of the other eight teams that competed in the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Scottish%20Premiership">2018–19 Scottish Premiership</a>, and all of the teams that competed in the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Scottish%20Championship">2018–19 Scottish Championship</a>, <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Scottish%20League%20One">2018–19 Scottish League One</a> and <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Scottish%20League%20Two">2018–19 Scottish League Two</a>, as well as the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Highland%20Football%20League">2018–19 Highland Football League</a> and the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Lowland%20Football%20League">2018–19 Lowland Football League</a> champions.
The winners of each of the eight groups, as well as the four best runners-up progressed to the second round (last 16), which includes the four UEFA qualifying clubs. At this stage, the competition reverts to the traditional <a href="Single-elimination%20tournament">knock-out</a> format. The four group winners with the highest points total and the clubs entering at this stage are seeded, with the four group winners with the lowest points unseeded along with the four best runners-up.
Bonus point system.
In December 2015, the SPFL announced that alongside the new group stage format, a bonus point system would be introduced to provide greater excitement and increase the number of meaningful games at this stage. The traditional point system of awarding three points for a win and one point for a draw is used, however, for each group stage match that finishes in a draw, a <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shoot-out</a> takes place, with the winner being awarded a bonus point.
Group stage.
The group stage was made up of eight teams from the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Scottish%20Premiership">2018–19 Scottish Premiership</a>, and all ten teams from each of the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Scottish%20Championship">2018–19 Scottish Championship</a>, <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Scottish%20League%20One">2018–19 Scottish League One</a> and <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Scottish%20League%20Two">2018–19 Scottish League Two</a>, as well as the winners of the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Highland%20Football%20League">2018–19 Highland Football League</a> and <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Lowland%20Football%20League">2018–19 Lowland Football League</a>. The 40 teams were divided into two sections – North and South – with each section containing four top seeds, four second seeds and 12 unseeded teams. Each section was drawn into four groups with each group comprising one top seed, one second seed and three unseeded teams.
The draw for the group stage took place on 28 May 2019 and was broadcast live on the SPFL YouTube channel.
Knockout phase.
Second round.
Draw and seeding.
The draw for the second round took place on 28 July 2019 at the conclusion of the <a href="Dundee%20F.C.">Dundee</a>-<a href="Inverness%20Caledonian%20Thistle%20F.C.">Inverness Caledonian Thistle</a> match. <a href="Aberdeen%20F.C.">Aberdeen</a>, <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a>, <a href="Kilmarnock%20F.C.">Kilmarnock</a> and <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a> entered the competition at this stage, after receiving a bye for the group stage due to their participation in <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a> club competitions.
The four UEFA-qualifying clubs and the four group winners with the best record were seeded for the draw.
Teams in Bold advanced to the quarter-finals.
Quarter-finals.
Draw.
Teams in Bold advanced to the semi-finals.
Semi-finals.
Draw.
Teams in Bold advanced to the final.
Teams in "Italics" were not known at the time of the draw.
Media coverage.
The domestic broadcasting rights for the competition are held exclusively by <a href="BT%20Sport">BT Sport</a>.
The following matches were broadcast live on UK television:
